p: The percentage contents of linalool (0.30–0.77%), 1,8-cineole (2.80–4.58%), and camphor (2.05–2.79%) found in volatile oils in this study were much lower than the results reported in the referenced literature. Essential oils isolated from plants grown on control medium and 50 mg·dm −3 AuNPs medium were the only ones with higher borneol content (16.00–16.46%) compared with the results obtained by Andrys and Kulpa [ 29]. Linalool, lavandulol, and their esters (linalyl acetate and lavandulyl acetate) are responsible for the fresh and floral smell of lavender oil. Moreover, the quality of oil depends on both a high content of linalool and linalyl acetate and their mutual proportions (preferably higher than 1) [ 34].
